posts.title: Node JS or React Native?
posts.body: Am at a dilemma right now. As am finishing learning React, I know I'll solidify my knowledge through making tones of projects. However, as I do so, I would also like to be learning a new technology. Should I do Node (back-end) or React Native (mobile)? Hmmm...

posts.title: JavaScript
posts.body: I love JavaScript. It's such an amazing programming language. I'm probably going to become a MERN stack developer.

posts.title: Interviews
posts.body: Interviews, am I right? I'm going for one right now. And am done, met some old workmates. I hope we get the parts.

posts.title: useContext
posts.body: useContext cleans up your app from all the prop drilling into components in through App. It puts all the "data"/ props into one file to be accessed throughout the application.
